0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Bitolterol mesylate (Tornalate(R)) is no longer available in the United States.
  • Asthma: ACUTE BRONCHOSPASM, metered dose inhaler, 2 puffs separated by 1 to 3 min, follow with third as needed
  • Asthma: PREVENTION OF BRONCHOSPASM, metered dose inhaler, 2 puffs every 8 h, MAX 3 puffs every 6 hr or 2 puffs every 4 hr
  • Asthma: PREVENTION OF BRONCHOSPASM, intermittent flow nebulizer, 0.5 to 1 mL (1 to 2 mg) 3 to 4 times per day, MAX 8 mg/day; continuous flow nebulizer, 1.25 mL (2.5 mg) 3 to 4 times/day, MAX 14 mg/day

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Bitolterol mesylate (Tornalate(R)) is no longer available in the United States.
  • Asthma: (12 y and older) ACUTE BRONCHOSPASM, metered dose inhaler, 2 puffs separated by 1 to 3 min, follow with third as needed
  • Asthma: (12 y and older) PREVENTION OF BRONCHOSPASM, metered dose inhaler, 2 puffs every 8 h, MAX 3 puffs every 6 hr or 2 puffs every 4 hr
  • Asthma: (12 y and older) PREVENTION OF BRONCHOSPASM, intermittent flow nebulizer, 0.5 to 1 mL (1 to 2 mg) 3 to 4 times per day, MAX 8 mg/day; continuous flow nebulizer, 1.25 mL (2.5 mg) 3 to 4 times/day, MAX 14 mg/day

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Bitolterol mesylate (Tornalate(R)) is no longer available in the United States.
  • Asthma
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Bitolterol mesylate (Tornalate(R)) is no longer available in the United States.
  • Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• cardiovascular disease, hypertension, arrhythmias
  • concomitant sympathomimetic bronchodilators, epinephrine, monoamine oxidase inhibitors, or tricyclic antidepressants
  • convulsive disorders
  • diabetes mellitus
  • hyperthyroidism

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Bitolterol: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Inhalation
  • (aerosol) allow 1-3 min between puffs
  • (solution) administer nebulized solution over 10 to 15 min; dilute in 2-4 mL of NS

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause tremor, feeling of nervousness, or throat irritation.
  • Instruct patient to report needing increased frequency or amounts of drug to provide symptomatic relief.
  • Advise patient on proper inhalation technique, depending on the delivery device used.
